what: Delete stale files in a cache — .cache_delete_stale
title: Delete stale files in a cache — .cache_delete_stale
text: Staleness determined number days 2am current day current time-zone. item cached one day becomes stale 2am day cached. time configurable option(cache.time_day_starts = 0) midnight. Automated analysis using caches updated data ensure analysis cross time point otherwise may end using old data.

title: Delete stale files in a cache — .cache_delete_stale
Delete stale files in a cache — .cache_delete_stale
text: .cache location cache directory. May get value options("cache.dir") default value rappdirs::user_cache_dir() .prefix name operation can namespace cached files selective clean operations .stale length time days keep cached data considering stale.

title: Delete stale files in a cache — .cache_delete_stale

what: A simple pass-through cache for complex or long running operations — .cached
title: A simple pass-through cache for complex or long running operations — .cached
text: executes expr saves output RDS file indexed code expr hash input variables (contain variable inputs)

title: A simple pass-through cache for complex or long running operations — .cached
A simple pass-through cache for complex or long running operations — .cached
text: .expr code output requires caching. return value create side effects change global variables. ... inputs code expr depends changes require code re-running, Sys.Date() .nocache option defeat caching can set globally options("cache.disable"=TRUE) .cache location cache directory. May get value options("cache.dir") default value rappdirs::user_cache_dir() .prefix name operation can namespace cached files selective clean operations .stale length time days keep cached data considering stale. can also set options("cache.stale")

title: A simple pass-through cache for complex or long running operations — .cached

title: Sprintf with a list input — sprintf_list
Sprintf with a list input — sprintf_list
code: library(tidyverse) #> ── Attaching core tidyverse packages ──────────────────────── tidyverse 2.0.0 ── #> ✔ dplyr     1.1.2     ✔ readr     2.1.4 #> ✔ forcats   1.0.0     ✔ stringr   1.5.0 #> ✔ ggplot2   3.4.2     ✔ tibble    3.2.1 #> ✔ lubridate 1.9.2     ✔ tidyr     1.3.0 #> ✔ purrr     1.0.1      #> ── Conflicts ────────────────────────────────────────── tidyverse_conflicts() ── #> ✖ dplyr::filter() masks stats::filter() #> ✖ dplyr::lag()    masks stats::lag() #> ℹ Use the conflicted package (<http://conflicted.r-lib.org/>) to force all conflicts to become errors # generate a mixture confidence interval from a set of distributions sprintf_list("%1.2f [%1.2f\u2013%1.2f]",  qmixnorm(p=c(0.5,0.025,0.975),  means=c(10,13,14), sds=c(1,1,2))) #> [1] "12.44 [8.54–16.88]"

code: univariate_from_multivariate(y ~ x1 + x2 + x3) #> [[1]] #> y ~ x1 #> <environment: 0x5624239d5300> #>  #> [[2]] #> y ~ x2 #> <environment: 0x5624239c9478> #>  #> [[3]] #> y ~ x3 #> <environment: 0x5624239c5520> #>  univariate_from_multivariate(~ x1 + x2 + x3) #> [[1]] #> ~x1 + x2 #> <environment: 0x56242391b490> #>  #> [[2]] #> ~x1 + x3 #> <environment: 0x562423919a40> #>
